snippet: Nowadays, rather than a perfumed delicacy, a bottle of Côte-Rôtie is more likely to be a powerhouse, big and fruity.
abstract: Eric Asimov The Pour column discusses preservation of the precious supply of wines from the Cote-Rotie area of France; classically the wines of this region were distinguished by the fragile balance among gorgeous, subtle aromas and delicate textures, but nowadays they are more likely to be a powerhouse, big and fruity and, especially when young, with the woody patina that comes from aging in new oak barrels.
lead_paragraph: Nowadays, rather than a perfumed delicacy, a bottle of Côte-Rôtie is more likely to be a powerhouse, big and fruity.

headline.seo: Côte-Rôtie and Its Various Styles - The Pour
